job_description: ALU IP Routing and Transport - Network and Service Management – 5620 SAM  This position is limited to students that are registered in a recognized Co-Op or Intern Program at a Canadian College or University As a student, you have lots of ideas to put to the test. At Alcatel-Lucent we will provide you with the opportunity to combine your ongoing academic pursuits with valuable, practical, hands-on experience.At Alcatel-Lucent you will join a team of people that is transforming communications, and you will help to create and support some of the most ambitious and innovative products in the telecommunications industry. If you have the talent, skill and passion, we want to hear from you! Our main products include:The 5620 Service Aware Manager (SAM) has more than 400 deployments globally, and delivers powerful capabilities that simplify operations across all domains of the converged networks.The 5650 Control Plane Assurance Manager (CPAM) is a multi-vendor route and path analytics solution. Integrated with the 5620 SAM delivers real-time visualization, surveillance and troubleshooting for dynamic IP/MPLS networks. Our products are built using various technologies, including:Java, JavaScript, JBoss, J2EE, JMS.Web Technologies (HTML5, CSS3, REST/JSON, SOAP/XML).Toolkits – Isomorphic Smart Client, EaselJS, Isotope, D3js, jQuery.Linux/RHEL/ Solaris x86/Windows/VM.Oracle 11, neo4J. As a User Interface Designer on our team, you will be challenged! The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include:Designing web-based and Java based GUIs for the management of telecommunication products.Working with development teams to define screen layouts and application workflows.Generate associated graphic elements in the software (icons, launch screens, etc).Working in a team-based Agile Environment; collaborate with Developers, Testers, and Product Management to refine requirements, develop, and test our products.
job_requirements: ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Enrolled in a User Interface design program (3rdor 4thyear).Strong graphic skills.Working knowledge in Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML and Dreamweaver.Working knowledge of human factors engineering, information architecture and interaction design.Experience in usability testing.Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.Demonstrated ability to learn quickly and to work in a fast paced, innovative environment. NOTE:Interested students should send their resume and provide a link to their portfolio. Alcatel-Lucent Canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage women, Aboriginal persons, persons with a disability or members of a visible minority group to apply.Open To All Majors:No
